subject: English Language

overview.description: Advanced English curriculum focusing on scientific communication, academic writing, and critical analysis for Pure Science students

learning_objectives: Develop advanced academic and scientific writing skills
Master effective oral communication for scientific contexts
Analyze and evaluate scientific and literary texts critically
Understand global scientific discourse and terminology
Apply English language skills to research and professional contexts

units.title: Scientific Communication and Academic Writing
learning_outcomes: Write clear and precise scientific reports and research papers

lessons.title: Scientific Writing Conventions and Style
objectives: Understand the structure and style of scientific writing
Apply appropriate register and tone for scientific texts
Use passive voice and formal language effectively

activities.description: Analyze exemplary scientific articles for structure and style
Practice writing scientific abstracts and introductions
Review and edit peer writing using scientific writing criteria
Revise writing based on feedback received

lessons.title: Research Paper Writing and Citation
objectives: Structure research papers following academic conventions
Integrate sources effectively using proper citation
Develop strong thesis statements and arguments

activities.description: Plan research paper topics related to scientific fields
Develop clear and arguable thesis statements
Practice integrating sources using quotes, paraphrases, and summaries
Apply proper citation formats for different source types

cross_curricular_connections: Science research: Primary and secondary sources

units.title: Critical Analysis and Scientific Literature
learning_outcomes: Analyze scientific texts for validity and reliability
Understand bias and perspective in scientific writing

lessons.title: Evaluating Scientific Claims and Evidence
objectives: Identify and evaluate scientific claims and evidence
Recognize logical fallacies and weak arguments
Assess the credibility of scientific sources

activities.description: Analyze scientific claims in popular media vs. peer-reviewed sources
Evaluate strength and relevance of evidence supporting claims
Identify common logical fallacies in scientific arguments
Assess author credentials and publication credibility

cross_curricular_connections: Science subjects: Scientific method and validity

lessons.title: Comparative Analysis of Scientific Perspectives
objectives: Compare different scientific perspectives on controversial topics
Understand how bias influences scientific interpretation
Synthesize multiple viewpoints into coherent analysis

activities.description: Map different perspectives on a scientific controversy (e.g., climate change)
Identify potential biases in scientific studies and reporting
Write comparative analysis synthesizing multiple perspectives
Discuss findings and challenge assumptions

cross_curricular_connections: Social studies: Perspective and bias understanding

units.title: Oral Communication and Presentation Skills
learning_outcomes: Deliver effective scientific presentations to diverse audiences
Participate confidently in academic discussions and debates
Use appropriate visual aids and technology
Adapt communication style to different contexts

lessons.title: Scientific Presentation Skills
objectives: Structure presentations for maximum impact and clarity
Use visual aids effectively to support oral communication
Develop confident delivery skills and manage presentation anxiety

activities.description: Plan presentation structure and key messages
Create effective slides and visual supports
Practice presentation delivery with feedback
Prepare for and practice handling audience questions

lessons.title: Academic Discussion and Debate
objectives: Participate effectively in formal academic discussions
Construct and present logical arguments
Listen actively and respond thoughtfully to others

activities.description: Research and prepare for academic discussion topics
Learn to build logical arguments with evidence
Participate in structured debates on scientific/ethical issues
Reflect on discussion performance and areas for improvement

units.title: Literature and Global Perspectives
learning_outcomes: Analyze literary works with scientific and technological themes
Understand global perspectives on science and technology
Appreciate cultural differences in scientific discourse
Connect literature to contemporary scientific issues

lessons.title: Science Fiction and Scientific Imagination
objectives: Analyze science fiction texts for scientific accuracy and speculation
Understand how literature explores scientific possibilities
Evaluate the relationship between science and imagination

activities.description: Select and introduce science fiction short stories or excerpts
Analyze scientific concepts presented in the literature
Discuss how authors speculate about future scientific developments
Write creative response connecting literature to current science

resources: Science fiction short stories and novels

lessons.title: Global Scientific Discourse and Ethics
objectives: Understand different cultural approaches to science and technology
Analyze ethical issues in global scientific contexts
Appreciate diversity in scientific communication styles

activities.description: Compare scientific articles from different cultural contexts
Analyze ethical dilemmas in international scientific research
Share and discuss different cultural perspectives on science
Make connections to international scientific collaboration

cross_curricular_connections: Social studies: Cultural understanding and ethics

differentiation_strategies: Choice in research topics and presentation modes
